item.content:encoded:
The Best 4K Gaming Monitor In 2021

If you’ve wanted to improve your gaming experience, there has never been a better time to buy a 4K gaming monitor. With recent technological developments, your options are limitless, and there is a 4K monitor for everyone.

A 4K gaming monitor will offer the best user experience, high resolution, large screen size, and fluid usability. Your games will undoubtedly be sharp and realistic.

But how do you choose the best 4K gaming monitor? What are the important things you should keep in mind, and what are the best options available in the market? 

You’ve come to the right place! Get ready to learn everything you need to know before choosing the best 4K monitor.

What Are The Benefits Of A 4K Gaming Monitor?

If you are a gamer who enjoys flawless visuals, a 4K gaming monitor is your answer. There are several benefits to choosing a 4K monitor over a traditional full HD screen.

Graphical Benefits

4K gaming monitors consist of tightly packed pixels right next to one another. Moreover, 4K resolution monitors comprise 4 times more pixels than a normal full HD screen. Due to the higher number of pixels, your gaming experience will be much sharper than before. 

Smaller details like clothing and facial expressions will be visible, and even differences in texture are noticeable. 

Wide View

The best 4K gaming monitors provide a large screen surface area. Compared to a traditional full HD screen, you can see more in-game objects in the corners and the sides in a 4K gaming monitor.

A wider field of view also makes your gaming experience realistic and intense since the screen is in your direct line of vision. 

Suitable for Consoles

4K gaming monitors are suitable for all gamers, whether you prefer the PC or console systems such as the PlayStation or Xbox.

A few consoles, such as the PlayStation 4 Pro, have been developed specifically so that they can display your games in 4K. The Xbox One S also upscales a full HD image to a 4K resolution.

Prerequisites To Using A 4K Gaming Monitor

While buying a 4K gaming monitor is bound to elevate your gaming experience, there are certain prerequisites that you will have to keep in mind:

Video Card of Your PC or Laptop

Your laptop or PC must support a 4K image signal if you want to make the most of your 4K gaming monitor. Ensure that you double-check the video card that your computer has before you buy the gaming monitor.

Gaming on a 4K monitor will require the right cable and a strong and reliable video card. Here are a few video cards (graphics) that you may consider:

  • Intel Iris Plus Graphics
  • NVIDIA Quadro Series
  • Intel UHG Graphics (from the eighth-generation Intel processors)
  • AMD Radeon RX and Pro series

Connectors and Cables

For the complete 4K monitor gaming experience, you will need an HDMI, DisplayPort, USB-C, or Thunderbolt 3 connector.

VGA and DVI connectors are older variants and will not support 4K gaming monitors. HDMI 1.4 may also be sufficient but transfers images at 30Hz, making fast-moving images appear ragged and slow.

Ensure that you choose the right cable for your connector. For the best gaming experience, the cable and connector should match perfectly. For example, a Thunderbolt 3 connector with a Thunderbolt 3 cable. Signals transfer the fastest when the cable and connector match.

Things To Look For In The Best 4K Gaming Monitor

Buying a 4K gaming monitor may seem like an easy feat, but there are multiple factors to consider. Since this is a huge investment, you cannot make this decision lightly.

If you are unaware of what to look for, the guide is here to help you. Below are some essential factors that should be present in the best 4K monitor.

Monitor Size

You are buying a gaming monitor because you want to get a complete gaming experience. That is why the size of a gaming monitor becomes a very crucial factor. If you choose small sizes, you would not be able to enjoy the gaming experience.

Ideally, the gaming monitor size should not be less than 24 inches. The bigger you go, the better your experience. However, it would help if you also remembered that as the size increases, so will the price.

Refresh Rate

Refresh rate decides the quality of your visual output and the number of times that the monitor will refresh a visual in one second. Most gaming monitors come in 120Hz or 144Hz since the frame rate is high without any breakage or stuttering.

When you choose monitors with these refresh rates, you need to ensure that the GPU can support the high frame rate. (https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/products/docs/processors/what-is-a-gpu.html)

Some monitors come with higher refresh rates, like 165Hz or even 240Hz. As the refresh rate increases, you need to be cautious that you go for a higher GPU.

Panel Type

Monitors come in two-panel types: IPS (in-plane switching) and TN (twisted nematic). 

IPS panels are well-known for their visual quality. The picture will be more accurate in color presentation and sharpness. However, the response time is more which is not good for high-end multiplayer games.

On the other hand, the TN panel has a response time of 1ms, which is perfect for competitive gaming. Monitors having TN panels are also a more affordable choice. However, the color saturation is not great, and this could be a problem for AAA single-player games.

Response Time

Response time is then taken by a single pixel to change from black to white or other shades of grey. This is measures in milliseconds or ms.

When you buy gaming monitors, it is better to choose a higher response time since it will eradicate motion blur and ghosting (https://www.onecomputerguy.com/1ms-vs-5ms). Response time between 1ms and 4ms would be good enough for single-player games.

If you are more into playing multiplayer games, it is advisable to choose a lower response time. It would probably be better if you opt for 1ms since this would ensure no pixel response delays.

Color Accuracy

A 4K gaming monitor’s color accuracy looks into the system’s ability to provide the necessary hue level without making any rough calculations.  

A 4K gaming monitor needs to have color accuracy on the higher end of the spectrum. Most monitors follow a standard RGB pattern to enable color adjustments. But these days, sRGB is quickly becoming the best way to ensure full coverage with perfect color delivery.

The best 4K gaming monitors provide a wide color gamut based on sRGB patterns of color delivery. If the color deviates, the system will present you with an error message represented as a Delta E figure (https://www.viewsonic.com/library/creative-work/what-is-delta-e-and-why-is-it-important-for-color-accuracy/). Most experts generally consider a Delta E figure of 1.0 to be the best.

Connectors

A gaming monitor will have ports for input and output. You should try to ensure that the monitor has these connectors – DisplayPort 1.4, HDMI 1.4/2.0, or 3.5mm audio out. 

Some brands offer you other types of connectors in their monitors. However, these are the ports or connectors that are the most important. If you need to plug USB devices directly into the monitor, check for USB ports to help you do so.

Curved monitors offer you a good field of view, so you do not exert your eyes. Just like flat monitors, they come in different sizes. However, unlike flat monitors larger size does not mean more strain on your eyes or increased discomfort.

If you are looking for new gaming monitors, then these 144Hz gaming monitors are the best. They have a standard refresh rate along with enhancing your gaming experience in many different ways.

How To Choose The Best 144Hz Curved Gaming Monitor

Gamers will need to find the right monitor that will enhance their gaming experience. When making this choice, there are several factors that you need to look into. 

Below are some of those factors or features you should consider while buying the best 144Hz curved gaming monitor.

Pixel Density

When it comes to gaming monitors, you should always go for larger screen sizes. The larger your screen size, the better you experience. However, when you increase the size of the screen, you need to keep a note of the pixel density.

Pixel density is the ratio of pixels per inch of the monitor’s size and resolution.

If the pixel density is low, then the image will become pixelated. This means you will be unable to view a clear image, and this will hinder your gaming. Higher pixel density means clearer details and more screen space.

Screen Size

Like I discussed, large screen sizes are not always for the best. It is also because large screen sizes will increase your budget. For most gamers, a 27 inches screen would be best for all types of gaming experiences.

They are large but not too much to create discomfort while playing. If the screen is too large, then you need to move your head from one corner to another too much.

When you choose a 27 inches monitor, the ideal resolution will be 2560 x 1440. In this, the pixel density will be approximately 109 pixels per inch. This ensures that you get the right details and screen space without the requirement of any scaling.

Widescreen / Ultrawide Screen

The aspect ratio for both these screens is different. In Ultrawide screen, (https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbes-personal-shopper/2020/10/28/best-ultrawide-monitors-2020-samsung-aw3420dw/) you get an aspect ratio of 21:9, while in widescreen, you get an aspect ratio of 16:9.

The horizontal space for the Ultrawide screen is 33% more than the widescreen. This makes the gaming experience much more engaging. This is extremely important in certain games where you need the field of view to be wide.

Even though most new games support the Ultrawide ratio, not all would be compatible. Games that are not compatible with the 21:9 ratio will give you black borders on both sides. If you do not wish to keep the black borders, you will have to see a stretched-out image.

Response Time

The response time of your curved gaming monitor is essential. It is the time taken by the monitor to respond to your inputs. When you choose your gaming monitor, ensure that the response time is on the lower scale.

The ideal response time would fall between 1ms and 5 ms. For highly competitive games, it is always advisable to choose a lower response time, preferably 1ms. However, if you are using very large displays, then 5ms would also be quite good.

Panel Types

There are three-panel types that are VA (Vertical Alignment), TN (Twisted Nematic), and IPS (In-Panel Switching).

In TN panels, the color reproduction is not as good as IPS panels, but the refresh rates are high. You will not be satisfied with the viewing angles of TN panels, but this may not be a problem for many.

IPS panels have good image quality and color reproduction. However, the refresh rates of these panels are quite low. VA panels are good for most gaming monitors and feature the good factors of the other two panels.

Why Are The Advantages Of A Curved Gaming Monitor?

Are you unable to decide if you should go for a 144Hz curved gaming monitor or flat monitor? To clear your confusion, I have highlighted some major advantages of curved monitors.

Immersive

If the image displayed on the monitor does not attract you, you will not get a complete gaming experience. In curved monitors, a technology called ocular perception is used, making you see images like in real life.

Curved monitors take into consideration all three dimensions, which are length, breadth, and height. This gives you an immersive experience which you will not find on flat monitors.

Eradicates Distortion

No one likes a blurry image or distortion in the edges of the image. This is a very common issue in flat monitors and not so much in curved monitors. Generally, when screen size increases, the distortion also increases.

However, in curved monitors, you are unlikely to face this issue.

Comfortable

Since the distortion is low or nil, you will be more comfortable using curved monitors. Your eyes will not experience any strain, and you can play games for long hours. Moreover, even with large screens, a curved monitor will not exceed your field of view.

In flat monitors, you will need to move your head to take in the full screen. This becomes a nuisance after a certain time, which is not a problem in curved gaming monitors.

Large Field of View

Like I mentioned in the earlier point, the field of view in curved gaming monitors is better than flat monitors. Both ends of the monitor are curved to ensure that the whole screen stays within your eye range.

You will not have to move your head or eyesight sideways to capture the whole screen. A curved screen ensures that light from all directions is directed to your eye. Hence you do not have to face much ocular exertion.

After the “release” of AMD’s first couple of Radeon RX 6000 Series GPUs, Nvidia answers back with the GeForce RTX 3060 Ti: A GPU that has no equal at its lower/mid-end price range. This graphics card is capable of displaying respectable framerates at high resolutions – similar to, and higher than, the GeForce RTX 2080 Super – at only a fraction of the cost of the other Nvidia 30 Series GPUs that feature the Ampere architecture.

To display the full graphical processing potential of the GeForce RTX 3060 Ti, you will need a monitor that can play to its strengths, and not go beyond its capabilities. To assist in this search, we’ve created a list of the best monitors for the GeForce RTX 3060 Ti; depending on resolution and framerate.

Related: Best Monitors for Nvidia RTX 3090 Graphics Card

Best 1080p 144 Hz Monitor for RTX 3060 Ti – Viewsonic Elite XG2705

This monitor can be purchased at either a 24-inch (XG2405), or 27-inch (XG2705) screen size, and it features an IPS panel with an 8-bit bit-depth: 6-bits plus Frame Rate Control (FRC). Its W-LED backlight is capable of displaying 1.68 million colors at 24 bits. covering an impressive 104% of the sRGB color spectrum and 72% of the NTSC color space. The XG2705 can reach a peak brightness of 250 nits, a static contrast ratio of 1000 to one (80,000,000: 1 dynamic contrast), and a Grey-to-Grey (G2G) response time of only 1 millisecond. Also, due to its IPS panel, it has a wide horizontal, and vertical, viewing angle of 178 degrees.

In terms of ergonomics, the screen can be mounted (VESA), pivot to the right (90 degrees), swivel in both directions (90 degrees), tilt forwards, and backward (5 and 20 degrees), and have its height adjusted by up to 120 mm.

Two HDMI 1.4 slots, one DisplayPort 1.2, and a 3.5 mm audio jack comprise its connectivity.

The ViewSonic Elite XG2705 can currently be found on sale for only $209.99; while, oddly enough, the 24-inch variant costs nearly double that at $399.99 – perhaps due to low current availability.

item.content:encoded:
After the recent release of the Ryzen 5000 Series Zen 3 processors, AMD has also announced their Radeon RX 6000 Series GPUs. The flagship of model of this series: The Radeon RX 6900 XT.

Benchmarks released by AMD for the Radeon RX 6900 XT, show us that this GPU excels in 1440p framerates, beating its Nvidia RTX 3000 Series competition in nine out of 10 games that AMD tested for their benchmarks, as it reaches over 120 FPS in all these titles. Thus, you can expect consistent framerates for 1440p resolutions, without needing to compromise in terms of game quality settings.

Going a step above the 1440p resolution, and into the 4K gaming territory, we see that the Radeon RX 6900 XT not only meets the 60 FPS mark, but it exceeds it by quite a margin. In fact, in the aforementioned benchmarks, it reaches – and exceeds – the 120 FPS threshold necessary for 4K 144 Hz gaming in half of the titles that were tested. If one were to slightly alter the in-game quality settings, the RX 6900 XT can surely reach the required framerate for the vast majority of AAA PC titles.

To admire the full processing power that a PC, equipped with AMD’s latest Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 Series processor and RDNA 2 Radeon RX 6900 XT graphics card, can muster, requires a monitor that also has the power to display this performance potential. Each monitor will hold distinct advantages and disadvantages, which is why the monitor that will accompany a PC build should be chosen based on each persons’ distinct gaming tastes. It is for this reason why we have listed the best monitors available in multiple different resolutions and framerates, to match any gaming preference one may have.
